title: Graph-based Adaptive Tool Evolution Across Diverse Tasks
author: Jianwen Luo (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Yiming Huang (Microsoft Research Asia), Jinxiang Meng (Nanjing Artificial Intelligence Research of IA), Fangyu Lei (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Shizhu He (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Xiao Liu (Microsoft Research Asia), Shanshan Jiang (Ricoh Software Research Center), Jun Zhao (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Kang Liu (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences)
relevance_why: The method presented in this paper focuses on adaptive tool generation and optimization which can be relevant for improving the tools used in audio processing or music generation tasks.
background: The study addresses the challenge of developing reusable toolsets through a framework that dynamically constructs an adaptive tool graph based on task requirements.
contribution: This paper introduces GATE, a framework that evolves a hierarchical tool graph to efficiently construct and evolve toolsets across various tasks, achieving faster milestone completion and improved performance in multi-task scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior methods faced issues like tool redundancy, specialized task applicability, and inefficiencies in tool creation.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances tool creation efficiency by assembling tools from existing ones rather than creating them from scratch, allowing for adaptive evolution and pruning of unnecessary tools.

key_innovation: The unique combination of two interacting agents, a Task Solver and a Tool Manager, working together to dynamically adapt a hierarchical tool graph enables more effective tool utilization.
real_world_impact: GATE's approach may significantly improve the efficiency of tool usage in various applications, including game development, coding tasks, and potentially audio synthesis tools.

new_terms.tool graph: **Tool graph** refers to a structured representation of tools and their dependencies, allowing for efficient searching, retrieval, and adaptation based on current tasks.
new_terms.adaptive evolution: **Adaptive evolution** describes the process by which a system modifies its structure and processes in response to new information or changing environments.

open_sourcing: Code and data are available at https://github.com/ayanami2003/GATE
